name: Best of North Vietnam Tour 9 Days 8 Nights (Hanoi, Sapa, Fansipan, Halong Bay and Ninh Binh)

reviews.review: The tour was very well organised from start to finish with clear instructions and seem less transfers between activities. The activities were fun and insightful and a highlight was the floating market. I felt we really saw how people on the Mekong Delta live and some Vietnamese traditions. The accommodations was basic but given the price reasonable - the home stay was very good and it was lovely speaking to a Vietnamese family. Our only surprise was how little time we actually spent travelling on the river - I had imagined that we would spend most of the time travelling to Cambodia on the river however the first two days we travelled by bus with the last day heading into Cambodia on a fast ferry for 5 hours.

All the pick-ups were on time, both the taxies and the day trips. Only the bus to Halong Bay had charging option on...
Show more
Tour guides Dong and Kai were very knowledgeable and made the tour interesting.

Overall ok/nice experience. Being a first-time visitor to Vietnam (but travelled to many other countries), the major challenge was to get the right information. Tour information is an indication: pick-up / drop-off point for bus was different from brochure (handy for hotel booking before and after), as well as programs for the days were different as described. But the groups were small and fun.
Sapa in general is quite touristic, so be prepared for many vendors anywhere (especially when business is slow due to corona virus). Weather can be (very) foggy and trails slippery, so bring good gear (clothing/shoes might not be available locally in the right sizes).

From the moment I booked the tour I had a contact name and number via WhatsApp. The tour itself was very well organised, each day a local guide was waiting to take me on walks through the villages. The hotel was very comfortable and food was good. Would recommend this tour.
